,
·
May 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Hosts are very responsive however the parking is super tight for stay. The neighborhood and parking lot is very questionable. The lights in bedroom were very dim hard to see for makeup, eye contacts, or even locating jewelry. Had to use cell phone flashlight to see. The shower head was eh- water control was hard to keep normal either burning hot or to cold. Very small bathroom
There was a cat urine smell inside through out rooms along cheap cleaner smell inside kitchen. The instructions for AC was very unbearable and not comfortable at 70 in Alabama. My son developed a cough and asthma attack on our stay due to temp that was “allowed” and cat urine smell in house. Lots of dust bunnies in master room under dresser. We couldn’t wait to get out. Nice decor but wouldn’t recommend

Of course! Here's a kind review you can use for Airbnb and owner Sylvia:
---
I had the most wonderful stay at Sylvia's Airbnb! From the moment I arrived, I felt welcomed and at home. Sylvia is not just a host; she's a true gem who goes above and beyond to ensure her guests have a fantastic experience.
The accommodations were immaculate, and the attention to detail was remarkable. The cozy bedroom, well-equipped kitchen, and charming living space made my stay incredibly comfortable. Sylvia's home is a true oasis of comfort and relaxation.
What truly sets this Airbnb apart is Sylvia herself. She's not just a host; she's a warm and caring person who genuinely cares about her guests.
I can't thank Sylvia enough for her hospitality and kindness. This Airbnb experience exceeded all my expectations, and I can't wait to return!

review_text: I have become a regular at Sylvia's listings. She's always very polite and quick to respond. I wanted until the last minute to book for the 4th and had to book 2 of her properties. They ended up being next door to each other. Instead of me having to leave and come back, she accommodated me by cleaning the second property first and allowed me to stay at the first property until cleaning was complete. The second night's stay at this property did come with a small problem with ants in the bedroom, which made me have to sleep in the other bedroom with smaller beds. It's the south and we've had a LOT of rain. Even if you think your house is air tight, they somehow still sometimes find a way in. Sylvia was quick to respond and even refunded me for the incident. I will continue to be a regular.

name: Derek

Rating, 3 stars
,
·
August 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Overall the experience was okay, but I was not impressed with the communication.
There was evidence that large dogs have been there and the home and the floors should be professionally cleaned.
I asked about having the lawn mowed and was informed it would be the following day but it did not occur for the remainder of our stay (5 more days).
During my stay , I repaired their vacuum (brushroll was inoperable and full of string/hair), replenished their clorox wipes, coffee, bleach, etc but when my kids broke two wine glasses by accident I was asked to pay for them and I did so immediately. A week later I was questioned when I would pay for them and I had to show that I had paid them a week prior. I could be in the wrong, but it bothered me that they asked me to pay for them to begin with considering the things I did and bought out of common courtesy.
I would still stay here again and this home is still much cleaner and nicer than the majority in the area.

review_text: This is a great find! The host was superb and his quick responses and information throughout our stay. We arrived after dark but the entryway and front door was very well lit which made our entrance to the house very easy and safe. The whole property had only small steps at the thresholds which was great for my octogenarian parents with limited mobility. We had access to the double door garage which was very nice and rare. We were happy to be able to park in the garage for added security. Also, the hosts have a treadmill and weight bench in the garage which was nice as an option for those dedicated to working out or walking/running even on rainy days. The house and furnishings were immaculate and tasteful. The home has a supply of games and activities for kids and families. The neighborhood was very walkable and clean. If we’re back in the area, we will definitely stay here again! It was an ideal home away from home.

review_text:
If you're looking for a comfortable, homey place to stay near Fort Rucker, Downtown Enterprise, and restaurants and shops, then this is Airbnb is the perfect choice.
The home itself is beautifully decorated and has a cozy, inviting atmosphere. You'll feel right at home from the moment you step inside. The screened in porch was lovely and inviting. A great place to relax at the end of the day. The beds were comfortable and the home was well stocked with all of the essentials. I especially appreciated the full size hair dryer!
From the moment I made my booking, the host was quick to respond to my messages and answer any questions. Throughout my stay, the host remained accessible and responsive. This level of attentiveness made my stay all the more comfortable and stress-free.
Overall, this Airbnb is an excellent choice for anyone visiting Fort Rucker or the Enterprise area. With its prime location, cozy atmosphere, and high-tech amenities, it truly feels like a home away from home.

review_text:
Wow - what’s not to love about this awesome house?! It’s 5 star all the way! The house is located in a beautiful, quiet neighborhood, which was great for walking. From the moment we walked in, we were amazed at how clean it was and how many extra touches there were throughout. They had everything we needed to feel right at home. The kitchen was very well stocked, including a wonderful coffee bar and our kids’ favorite - a waffle maker! We enjoyed our morning coffee and meals on the beautiful screened patio. There was plenty of room for all 7 of us to sit comfortably and watch a movie together.
Ivan is super responsive and so nice to work with! He even helped me out when I made a mistake on our reservation, which was so appreciated! We highly recommend this house and definitely hope to stay here again when we visit our son.

We are regular Airbnb travelers and would rate Ivan’s place as one of the nicest homes we have stayed. The house was very clean, modern & had everything we needed to feel at home. Comfortable beds & we appreciated the fully stocked coffee and tea cart. Eating dinner outside under the enclosed covered porch was delightful & enjoyed by all. We also enjoyed playing the many games provided in the home. Ivan was super responsive & and allowed an early check in time which was very helpful for my 97 year old mother who was traveling with us.
Highly recommended & we hope to stay again when visiting our son who is currently in flight school at Fort Rucker.

review_text: Our stayed in Ivan’s Airbnb was so very enjoyable. It was probably the cleanest Airbnb I have ever stayed in. Kitchen was well stocked and had plenty of extra trash bags, paper towels, dishwasher pods, cooking spray and some seasonings. And the little stocked coffee bar was a nice touch. Refrigerator was super clean and had an ice maker which is always a plus. We enjoyed our meals on the screened in porch and the gas grill was super nice and new. The beds were super comfortable and the bedding was oh so soft and inviting. There was workout equipment in the garage if you desire to keep fit during your stay. Also plenty of boxed games to entertain yourself with in the evenings and some toys for the youngsters. We had no issues whatsoever and communication with Ivan was great. Don’t hesitate for a second to book your next Airbnb stay with Ivan.

review_text: Ivan’s place was extremely cozy for our family of 7, including a toddler. Check in and out was a breeze. Ivan was quick to respond to any questions or concerns. The kitchen was stocked with all tools needed to make our meals. We really loved the board games as there wasn’t much to do around the area. We were also so appreciative of the baby/toddler items that were provided as it made it so much easier for our family. We truly enjoyed staying here and would definitely stay again in the future!

Stayed with kids
review_text: This home was a blessing to stay in. We found it to be even better than the pictures! All the linens were of higher quality. Our tween and teen girls fell in love with how soft and incredibly comfortable the bunkbeds were. They were sad to leave the beds behind! We found our beds to be just as comfortable and ideal! The kitchen was very well stocked which we greatly appreciated. And Ivan and his team did an incredible job getting us a grill to use on short notice. We were blown away by their thoughtfulness!! I should also mention all 6 of our tweens and teens enjoyed the foosball table and electronic game board. They were both big hits! The backyard was also a fantastic space to throw our football and frisbee around. The kids also appreciated that they didn’t get any mosquito bites while in the backyard. It was a fantastic stay! Thank you for sharing your incredible place with us!

·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: What an outstanding townhouse and location. Several things all played into the 5 star rating. First the townhouse: it was clean, tidy, well appointed and everything was as promised. Two very large bedrooms and large actually doesn’t describe their size well enough. A small but well stocked kitchen and dining table was perfect for breakfasts at the house. We were fortunate to have access to the garage and that was such a plus. Second the communication: absolutely outstanding. Not just timely communications but everything was followed up with another note. A question we had was replied to within 30 minutes. We really felt that anything we needed would be accommodated if possible. Third is location: if you are there to access Fort Rucker you are less than 5 minutes to one of the gates. We were there for our son’s graduation from flight school and this was PERFECT. Plus we were closer to downtown Enterprise which was nice since it’s such a quaint town. We HIGHLY recommend Sylvia’s AirBNB!

name: Chris
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We travel a lot, and I've entered many Airbnb. I long to be able to enter then relax. Unfortunately, because of my work in the construction industry, my eye for detail and workmanship keeps me from just being. I tend to see everything(bad). I'm sure its mental. Entering this home gave me a unique opportunity to both relax and respect great workmanship. Everything from the rustic log cabin interior to the floor elevation change in the kitchen just so a set of stairs wouldn't look out of place reaching the second-floor kid's loft. Trimming every nook and softening every angle. Knock down ceilings with a flawless 45-degree corner bead. Little lanterns hardwired for accent lighting. Ductless splits installed level and tight to the wall. As one old timer told me years ago. "If you have no pride in what you're doing, you'll have no shame in doing it poorly.". This home is unique in that way, (forgiving the tile, lol) and it was a pleasure to stay in. Quiet, cozy and relaxing. Thanks again!.

review_text:
‘The Clubhouse’ – An Absolute Must See!
I have had the good fortune of staying at all 3 of Larry’s properties, which are uniquely beautiful in their own way. BUT, I must say that this is, by far, the most well-thought-out and creatively designed rental property that I have ever stayed at. Not only is it aesthetically pleasing with its woodworking style, creativity, design and layout, it is also fully functional / equipped, modern, elegant, comfortable and clearly focuses on the needs of the Guests, by providing a much appreciated attention to detail, in order to ensure all the comforts of home, and then some.
The carpentry, rustic, yet comfortable, furniture and décor, coupled with the modern and elegantly styled kitchen, with all the amenities and appliances (small and large), make it an ideal accommodation, which can be appreciated by both men, women and children alike.
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND staying at The Clubhouse, for both short and long-term stays. You’ll be glad you did.

The rustic feel and the amenities provided made for a memorable and comfortable stay. The first thing that struck me about the Airbnb was the warm and inviting ambiance. The rustic decor was tastefully done and added to the place's charm. It truly felt like a home away from home.
The amenities provided were top-notch and everything a guest could need was available. The kitchen was well-stocked with all the necessary utensils and appliances, making cooking and preparing meals easy. The bathroom was clean and had plenty of towels and toiletries.
The bed was comfortable and cozy, and I slept soundly throughout my stay. The linens were soft and luxurious, adding to the overall comfort of the space. One of the things that stood out to me was the attention to detail. Everything was thoughtfully arranged and the small touches really added to the overall experience.
Overall, my stay at this charming Airbnb was truly exceptional.

The apartment itself I immediately felt comfortable and relaxed when I walked in. It’s a beautiful place and very clean! You definitely get your money’s worth and more! The location is so nice!

,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We needed a large home for all our family & we felt extremely comfortable here - 4 bedrooms, two full baths, full kitchen, large living room & laundry room. We were able to cook many meals in the kitchen & hang out as a family all under one roof. The home provided many thoughtful & helpful touches like a work desk, warm blankets & extra pillows, coffee & filters!!!, 2 smart TVs, toys & corn hole for the little ones, tasteful decor, well-lit entry, extremely comfortable beds to include a trundle bed for one of the grandkids, highchair, baby tub, playpen & outdoor/firepit chairs for both the adults and kids. Although we did not need anything pet-related, we noticed a nice pet bed plus food bowls & dry food for both cats & dogs. The carport allowed for easy entrance to the side of the house & a circular driveway allowed for easy parking & entry to the front of the house. The fenced in the backyard was large, pretty & private - the grandkids really enjoyed playing in the backyard!

name: Juan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: Property was easy to find and Maria was easy to reach when the digital code did not work. Inside the home was very clean and inviting with all the amenities and cleaning product available to clean after ourselves. Backyard is fenced and peaceful there is a large amount gap underneath the fence for small dogs to potentially get outside the compound. Also I dislike most dog owners since they can clean after their pets. My daughter cleaned multiple dog feces (not all) from the backyard so she and her brothers could run outside without stepping in poop. She did (as always) go outside with her dog and clean her dogs mess as to not contribute to the left behind messes. The street in the front is also busy with high speed traveling cars and trucks and would not recommend small kids or pets in the front only the back. Plenty of space to park vehicles as we had 5 with us for our military PCS move. Overall very satisfied with our stay even with the previous slack dog owners trying to ruin it.

name: Regina
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We were in town for my daughter's wedding. Had a hiccup getting in but that was quickly resolved. No problems after that. If we had questions Maria responded quickly. All of the bedrooms were nice size. The bed in the master bedroom is quite low to the floor, this is only a problem if you have mobility issues like I do, I just slept in another bed and our toddler granddaughter slept in the master bedroom with her Pepaw and the 1 year old slept in the travel playpen provided at the rental house also in master bedroom and still left plenty of room to walk. Bathrooms are nice, the toilets are a little low, again not a problem unless you have mobility issues like me so I carry a raised toilet seat for that reason. The house is child friendly but not child proof. There are cleaning supplies in the cabinet under the kitchen sink that is not lockable. The house had everything listed in amenities. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks for the hospitality!

review_text: This place was excellent. We had a great time here and Maria was very helpful. We let her know we would be arriving late and she left a light on for us. Also, the house was very clean and close to town. However, it is on a main road, but has a side street and a nice private backyard. We didn’t notice much noise from the traffic other than occasional cars passing. Maria was very helpful, especially when we had some unexpected visitors knocking on the door late at night. Maria answered her phone on the first call and checked the exterior cameras. She also kept an eye on the cameras and notified me when she saw another unexpected visitor. We later determined that someone down the road was having a party and some of the party goers we confused with the address. This only happened one night of our stay, the rest of the days were no problem at all and the neighborhood appeared quiet otherwise. Would would definitely recommend and stay here again.

name: Wendy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We stayed at this property August 30-September 1, 2022 when we travelled to Alabama to see our son graduate from AIT training at Fort Rucker Army Base. The house was clean and decorated very nice. The location of the home was very quiet and peaceful. The layout of the home was perfect because there were three bedrooms including the master at one end of the house and one bedroom at the opposite end of the house which worked out perfect for the teenage girls in our family.
There are a few things I want to say about this host. First, we had to change our reservation because my son's graduation date was pushed about a week. The host, Maria, allowed us to change our reservation with no additional charge and was so accommodating to us during this stressful time.
Second, when we arrived at the home, the air conditioning wasn't working properly. The house was 85 degrees and much too warm for my comfort. We set the thermostat to 74 but by morning the temperature had only dropped to 79 after running four about 8 hours (again too warm for my comfort). In addition to the AC issue, the toilet in the master bathroom ran on and off all night long. I contacted Maria right away about both issues. Not only did she respond within 4 minutes of my message, she had both a plumber and an HVAC technician to the house within an hour to take care of both issues. Unfortunately, the AC didn't seem to improve much so I reached out to Maria again to let her know. She was very apologetic for the inconvenience and since she didn't know if her HVAC guy could come back the same day, she had her handyman run to the store and get us three wonderful tower fans which we used that night, and it made a huge difference.
Given the few issues we had, I would definitely rent from this host again. She was on top of everything, and I feel she went above and beyond to make sure our stay was the best it could be.
Thank you, Maria and Andrew. You are both fantastic hosts and I would recommend you to anyone looking for a nice AirBNB in Enterprise, Alabama.
Wendy Gale and family

review_text: This was literally the most perfect place for a family of four to stop on the way to the beach. The backyard was the most beautiful oasis and the perfect safe place for a toddler to run around, equipped with toddler size Adirondack style chairs, a sandbox, a swing in the sunroom, Amazon prime for Cocomelon, and even a pull out floor mattress so there is no worry of toddler falling out of bed at night. There was also a pack n play and a high chair which we used for our infant! All necesseities like dishwasher detergent, plates, cups, dishes, pizza cutter, laundry detergent, paper towels were provided in excess where we didnt have to worry about running out. This was the perfect place and we would definitely stay here again and for a longer stay if we had something else to do in Enterprise. It was the perfect stop for one night on the way to the beach but a fantastic little hideaway we would love to return to!

review_text:
Hidden gem! Very spacious open concept kitchen & living room. Cozy beds, large open main bedroom with cute extra bedrooms blended into floor plan. Nice to see an older historic building renovated in a beautiful way. Loved the wood floors throughout! Easy entry process, but fair warning 2 small flights of stairs with no elevator , difficult for elderly. Huge kitchen with plenty of room to entertain family dinners. Long Cozy couch to watch tv or enjoy game night.
Great Location downtown in Enterprise! Walking distance to a variety of local shops and small restaurants for full meals or breakfast, coffee and doughnuts, bars , farmers market, Southern Broadway dinner theater, clothing stores, book stores, candy and soap stores , unique souvenir shops even 2 baby stores offering 4D ultra sounds. In the heart of the Historic district full of history and great opportunities for pictures. You will hear local church bells in morning till evening . ER/ hospital close by, and Library to walk to.

name: Roseann
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
November 2022
,
·
Group trip
review_text:
The positives: It’s a beautifully restored historic building. Very spacious and decorated beautifully. The furnishings are very comfortable. The beds were very comfortable and extra blankets were available. The location couldn’t be better. It’s within walking distance of several eateries, shopping and historic sites. Parking is on the Main Street and even though an event was going on, there was ample parking available. Enterprise itself is a fun place to explore.
Not so positive:
There’s no elevator. I think that should be mentioned in the description so guests are aware.
The staircase doesn’t have any railing for part of it and the railing that is on the upper level is loose. If someone leaned against it, I think it would give
I always leave the places I rent in good shape and automatically clean up but we were expected to wash, dry, fold and put away the extra blankets. I feel that is asking a bit too much.
Supplies like toilet paper, trash bags, soap, etc., were minimal or not provided.
There is a Keurig coffee maker - not mentioned in description, so I didn’t know to bring K-cups.
In summary, it’s a lovely place to stay, just be aware of the above items.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Absolutely amazing loft in a perfect location for flight school graduation. Beautifully decorated and equipped, we prepared dinner our first night followed by drinks at a local upscale bar and grill located a short walk away. There’s a great selection of shops up and down Main St as well as a farmer’s market on Tuesdays and Saturday mornings. The restaurant in the Rawls hotel is perfect for any special occasion dinner, we loved the player baby grand piano and we were serenaded by our waiter as well. Cara went out of her way to make our stay enjoyable, will definitely stay at this loft again!!!

name: Steven
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My wife and I stayed in the loft while attending an event for our son at nearby Fort Rucker. We were very pleased with the prompt and courteous communications we received from Cara. Everything in the booking went smoothly. We arrived in the early evening and were quite pleased to find some of the lights on and the A/C set to a comfortable temperature when we arrived. We were quite road-weary, and this was a nice and welcoming touch. We were able to park in a parking lot just across from the entrance door on the side of the building, which was very convenient.
The loft was a lovely mix of historic and modern updates. The brick walls, high ceilings and wooden floors meshed well with the updated kitchen and baths and the wall-mounted televisions. The loft was well-decorated and comfortable. Everything was clean and neat and orderly and exactly as described in the listing. The bed was comfortable and there was plenty of hot water for showers. Being that there were only the two of us, we were swimming in all of the space, and it felt kind of elegant. Our military son came by to see the place and deemed it "a really neat place".
Others have commented on the street noise, and we got to experience some of it. We were awakened on Friday morning by the city street cleaner at 4 a.m. as it made its way down Main Street. We were getting up early, anyway, so it wasn't too big of a deal for us. The street cleaner returned to clean the street next to the loft at 6 a.m. We were preparing to leave for our day at this point, so again it wasn't an issue. While it was a bit noisy at a very early hour, we recognized that we were living in a downtown setting and also appreciated the city's desire to have clean streets.
In the evenings and overnight, there were several "vehicular enthusiasts" who liked to rev their engines as they raced down Main Street, but there's nothing that can be done about that. We normally live in a very quiet, rural area, so having to deal with some "city" noise was a change for us, but not so much as to make us unhappy. The bell tower tolling throughout the day was actually quite pleasant, and it didn't bother us at all. The noises we heard were understandable and did not detract from our stay. We mention it only to let others know what to possibly expect and to have reasonable expectations. We chalked it up to being in an urban setting and just rolled with it.
We were there three days and two nights, and it suited our needs perfectly. Local businesses were plentiful and all within walking distance. The Downtown Donuts shop a few blocks away was well worth the walk on Saturday morning. Getting to Fort Rucker and around to various stores and restaurants around the area was easy. Coming back each night to the loft was a pleasure.
Check out was as easy as it gets: clean up after yourself, leave the bed unmade so they know where you slept, take out the trash, turn up the thermostat, turn off the lights and lock your door on the way out. Couldn't have been simpler or more straight-forward.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the loft and would stay there again if we travel to Enterprise in the future. The mild inconvenience of some street noise is not enough to keep us from returning. The vintage loft with modern conveniences was well-worth it. Staying there made our trip much more enjoyable and memorable than staying in a hotel. The loft has character and charm and history. That we would stay there again is as good an endorsement as we can give.

name: Liz
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
June 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Pretty nice place. We liked the location, being right in the downtown area. The restaurants and shops close by were awesome (Coffee Corner, Annie’s, Cafe Roma, Downtown Donuts), but the church bells across the street go off every hour on the hour (8 AM until 9 PM). The bells also go off for 15 minutes straight at 8 AM, 12 PM, and 5 PM - something to keep in mind if you’re a light sleeper, because the walls in the master bedroom are paper thin. You’ll be woken up all night by loud cars driving by and promptly at 8 AM by your 15 minute church-bell alarm. However, the bed is very comfortable. The other bedroom is MUCH quieter and still has a nice queen size bed, and the tv is way closer to the bed which is nice too! The kitchen has basic utensils and pans, but the cabinets and drawers have a weird smell, so we washed everything before using it. And if you’re going to cook, you’ll need to buy your own salt, pepper, and every basic cooking need. The balcony is pretty but it’s not accessible. We also saw several small roaches, flies, and other bugs. The bathtub in the master bathroom has jacuzzi settings, but started oozing this gross yellow stuff when we tried to use it. The bare minimum of towels, toilet paper, and paper towels is provided. It was enough for 2 of us for 2 nights, but if you’re staying for a week with more than 2 people, it would be frustrating having to bring your own toilet paper. Overall, it was a fine place to stay. Very very spacious, easy check in and check out, mostly nice location.

This is our second time having stayed at Scott's listing and things went perfectly both times! The unit is as described, very clean, comfortable beds, seamless check-in, and great A/C (which is a must for us). The only call-out (which is no fault of the owners) is that this listing is located near a busy highway, so the road noise bothers me a bit when it's time for bed (only bc I need it silent to fall asleep). It didn't bother the other guests who were with me, so I slept with a sound machine and that did the trick for me! Just something to be aware of.
SUPER kid-friendly. They have toddler cups, a high chair, a pack and play and even a few toys. The kitchen is also equipped with everything you need to cook.
Scott is thoughtful and incredible host - extremely responsive and even accommodated a last-minute late check out request. We will absolutely stay here again!

,

Stayed with kids
review_text:
We cannot give a high enough recommendation for this place. We had a last minute booking as we found ourselves at a less than desired rental home during our family road-trip. It was our son’s birthday and the hosts kindly welcomed our late arrival with personalized amenities to support our family movie night.
The home was incredibly clean and comfortable. Good shower pressure, fans in every room, comfortable beds and bedding. Carport was a plus to keep our car safe and reduce the heat.
The hosts go out of their way to ensure the stay is comfortable and accommodating. They communicate with kindness and expediency.
My kids renamed it the “sunny home” based on the awesome sunporch. My husband and I enjoyed coffee (provided by the hosts) on the sunporch as we planned out the next leg of our road-trip.
The value cannot be beat for the level of attention provided by the hosts.
Highly recommend staying at LA the next time you pass through the area!
